segments.text: I see the woman drying the plate, completely unaware of what's happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so focused on that plate, like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or distracted to not notice the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just standing there, drying that plate, while everything else is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she's thinking about, to be so completely absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so calm and peaceful, like nothing can bother her right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must really love drying dishes, to be so focused on it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she realizes what's happening soon, before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a strange sight, to see someone so completely unaware of their surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she's going to be really surprised when she finally looks up and sees the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
